Comments_List: In this course, you will learn the basics of scientific glass blowing, different
How to make basic scientific glassware (round bottoms, side seals, straight seals, hooks, bends, distillation columns, etc.)
I learned various techniques for cutting, sealing, and blowing glass.

The only way this course could be approved is if was worth 1 (or even 1/2) credit towards graduation for undergrads. Overall, this is a fantastic course. It is at 9 am on science hill, but not once did I dread going-- I was always great start to the day. It's such a fun new skill to learn, and it would be hard to find an opportunity to ever get to do this outside of this context.
Literally no weaknesses, this course is an absolutely unique gem and you should absolutely take it!
Professor Smith and Preston are both great! They are super helpful and supportive. It was a great experience!

I would recommend this course to anyone who has time in their schedule. It's a fantastic course to take your senior year to have an easier workload. But if you have the time your junior year, it would be a great course to take earlier, because you can use the glass shop after you take the course.  Even though there's no homework, it is a skill that requires a lot of practice so having time in your schedule to work outside of the class time is pretty essential if you want to improve at all.

ABSOLUTELY take it if you want to learn a new skill; Daryl and Preston are amazing and walk you through everything. Everyone always stayed after class ended to keep working because it was so enjoyable.
Yes! Glassblowing is so unique from any other course I've taken at Yale. I highly recommend the course if you can get a spot.
